body:
Hello @SweetStripes74! It's strange that cuda libraries cannot be found; they are normally automatically pulled by conda when installing cudnn. After activating your environment, try the following:
`conda install cudatoolkit=10.0`, this should resolve it.
As for the permissions, make sure you open the command prompt with administrator rights :)

For symlinks, if you don’t have admin privileges, you can also have an admin follow [these directions](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/security/threat-protection/security-policy-settings/create-symbolic-links) to add them to your user account. I’ve done this (and I have admin privileges) so that I don’t have to remember to start the anaconda window as an admin every time.

I guess I am confused as to why I need admin privileges to add more videos to my config file to create a new training index. I am using this for a school project in my masters so I'm uncertain if I can do anything admin based without contacting IT. For the admin rights, would using sudo commands instead of the GUI work instead?

You’re. It just adding video paths to the configuration file. You are also (in the background) adding a symlink (shortcut) to the project videos folder that points to the original video file. Windows prevents command line programs from adding symlinks without admin access. 

You can either see if you can get IT to give your user account symlink privileges using the directions I linked to above, or set it to copy the videos, which will add a full video file rather than just a symlink.

1) The CUDA install worked, thank you!
2) So I was able to then run as administrator and I came across another error. I had it set originally to copy the videos the first time and it did, but now it's not giving the choice on the GUI (it's greyed out). Is there a helper command for copying and adding the videos to an existing config? Below is the admin run error I got when trying to add videos to the config:
(base) C:\WINDOWS\system32>activate DLC-GPU

```python
(DLC-GPU) C:\WINDOWS\system32>ipython
Python 3.7.10 | packaged by conda-forge | (default, Feb 19 2021, 15:37:01) [MSC v.1916 64 bit (AMD64)]
Type 'copyright', 'credits' or 'license' for more information
IPython 7.23.1 -- An enhanced Interactive Python. Type '?' for help.

In [1]: import deeplabcut
2021-06-24 13:12:58.618244: I tensorflow/stream_executor/platform/default/dso_loader.cc:44] Successfully opened dynamic library cudart64_100.dll

In [2]: deeplabcut.launch_dlc()
more networks are available soon for maDLC, but currenlty this uses DLC-ResNet50 only
adding new videos to be able to label ...
Creating the symbolic link of the video
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
OSError                                   Traceback (most recent call last)
~\anaconda3\envs\DLC-GPU\lib\site-packages\deeplabcut\gui\create_new_project.py in add_videos(self, event)
    427         if len(self.filelistnew) > 0:
    428             self.filelistnew = self.filelistnew + self.addvids
--> 429             add_new_videos(self.cfg, self.filelistnew)
    430         else:
    431             print("Please select videos to add first. Click 'Load New Videos'...")

~\anaconda3\envs\DLC-GPU\lib\site-packages\deeplabcut\create_project\add.py in add_new_videos(config, videos, copy_videos, coords)
     77                 src = str(src)
     78                 dst = str(dst)
---> 79                 os.symlink(src, dst)
     80
     81     if copy_videos:

OSError: [WinError 1] Incorrect function: 'G:\\Batch 1 AT Data Sept 2018\\0901_010304_010305_C-converted.mp4' -> 'G:\\AppWithAdult-PDH-2021-03-29\\videos\\0901_010304_010305_C-converted.mp4'
```

Odd. 
Check out

`deeplabcut.add_new_videos`

In the docs. 

Run that in ipython, pass your config, a list of videos, and whether or not you want to copy.

issue.title: CUDA Libraries Not Loading; Follow Up to #1346

repository.name: DeepLabCut
repository.description: Official implementation of DeepLabCut: Markerless pose estimation of user-defined features with deep learning for all animals incl. humans

license.name: GNU Lesser General Public License v3.0

issue.body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing issues

### Bug description

After attempting to update to the new 2.2 release noted, I got a previously existing issue I had fixed in issue #1346.
In issue #1346 I had an issue in which the cuda libraries were not installed as an error for the 2.2rc1 release. However, now I have an issue where I tried updating to 2.2.0 (the most recent update that came out 10 days ago I believe?) it only updated to 2.2rc3 and recreated the same error. I have tried reinstalling cudatoolkit with the command mentioned in the previous issue a few times but still no avail. I tried other versions too but regardless it won't eliminate the error. Is 2.2rc3 the latest version?
What I was expecting was being able to update to 2.2.0 and not have the error pop up again; however, I'm uncertain if I installed the right information/toolkit

### Operating System

Windows 10

### DeepLabCut version

2.2rc3; trying to update

### DeepLabCut mode

single animal

### Device type

Geforce GTX 1080 Ti

### Steps To Reproduce

1) In the environment DLC-GPU, run ipython in the terminal
2)Next, import deeplabcut.     _Cuda toolkit error about the libraries pops up immediately_
3)deeplabcut.__version__     _This then tells me the version is 2.2rc3_
4)pip install "deeplabcut[gui]"  _The output from this says all issues are met and no updates were done at all_

### Relevant log output

```shell
(base) C:\Users\ninsellab>activate DLC-GPU

(DLC-GPU) C:\Users\ninsellab>conda install cudatoolkit=10.0
Collecting package metadata (current_repodata.json): done
Solving environment: done

# All requested packages already installed.


(DLC-GPU) C:\Users\ninsellab>ipython
Python 3.7.10 | packaged by conda-forge | (default, Feb 19 2021, 15:37:01) [MSC v.1916 64 bit (AMD64)]
Type 'copyright', 'credits' or 'license' for more information
IPython 7.23.1 -- An enhanced Interactive Python. Type '?' for help.

In [1]: import deeplabcut
2021-08-16 21:26:44.076098: W tensorflow/stream_executor/platform/default/dso_loader.cc:64] Could not load dynamic library 'cudart64_110.dll'; dlerror: cudart64_110.dll not found
2021-08-16 21:26:44.076174: I tensorflow/stream_executor/cuda/cudart_stub.cc:29] Ignore above cudart dlerror if you do not have a GPU set up on your machine.

In [2]: deeplabcut.__version__
Out[2]: '2.2rc3'

In [3]: pip install 'deeplabcut[gui]'
ERROR: Invalid requirement: "'deeplabcut[gui]'"
Note: you may need to restart the kernel to use updated packages.
```
